result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan Lamar Perkins

records.addlTxt: Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins not in court, in custody.  Michael Govin appeared by video for Donovan Lamar Perkins.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Annie Louk for Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court, defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defendants appearance has been waived for the purpose of todays hearing. Attorney Govin was recently appointed and informs court that they are not in a position to resolve today. No objections from the state. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date, and sets 08/22/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request to Cancel Order to Produce
Received and Filed. Proposed Order Granting Substitution of Counsel
Received and Filed. Substitution of Counsel Stipulation
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 049566,
Payable Number: 1008901,
Receipt Number: 22RP021215,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Further Proceedings. Defense counsel advises that the defendant is now in custody on pending charges. Court withdraws stayed bench warrant and further vacates 06/06/2022 Calendar Call date. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing date to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for a Scheduling Conference on 05/19/2022 at 01:30 PM, Br 16.
Attorney Martin Tanz informs court via phone that he has another matter in Ozaukee County and is unavailable for today's hearing. Case to be re-scheduled off the record.

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussions with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense requests additional time to speak with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins in court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Maritato.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER - ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Donovan Lamar Perkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan Lamar Perkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
